subject: In JUnit 4.1, how do you tell the test runner to stop running tests?

I'm using Eclipse 3.2 using the JUnit 4.1 test runner along with ANT 
1.7.0=
beta1 to do development, and then when I deploy everything is 
executed fro=
m ANT 1.7.0beta1 using JUnit 4.1 with the <junit> and 
<junitreport> tasks.=


In my JUnit test class I have a @BeforeClass method which checks to 
make=
 sure that the necessary properties (arguments) have been passed 
before ev=
en beginning the test methods.  In my @BeforeClass method, how 
do I tell t=
he runner to exit?
I've looked through UserStopTest.java, and I know that t=
he secret lies 
somewhere in accessing the runner notifier and using the pl=
easeStop() 
method, but it is eluding me.

If someone could drop an example=
 that would be great!
